TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IWithVolumeMountSetting`1<ParentT>

Docs.typeparam: The stage of the parent definition to return to after attaching this definition.
Docs.summary: The stage of the container instance definition allowing to specify volume mount setting.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Azure.Management.ContainerInstance.Fluent.ContainerGroup.Definition.IWithContainerInstanceAttach`1<!ParentT> WithReadOnlyVolumeMountSetting(class System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2<string, string> volumeMountSetting) cil managed
Public Function WithReadOnlyVolumeMountSetting (volumeMountSetting As IDictionary(Of String, String)) As IWithContainerInstanceAttach(Of ParentT)

Docs.param: The name and value pair representing volume names as defined in the volumes of the container group and the local paths the volume will be mounted at.
Docs.summary: Specifies the container group's volume to be mounted by the container instance at a specified mount path. Mounting an Azure file share as a volume in a container is a two-step process. First, you provide the details of the share as part of defining the container group, then you specify how you wan the volume mounted within one or more of the containers in the group.
Docs.return: The next stage of the definition.
Docs.throws: IllegalArgumentException thrown if volumeName was not defined in the respective container group definition stage.
